explanation: Agent A is correct. The expression statement (void) cls; evaluates a non-volatile parameter and has no side effects; removing it would not change program behaviour. By the Rule 2.2 definition — “Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code” — this construct is dead code. The same applies to the similar lines for version and upload_data. To comply, either remove the unused parameter name from the function definition (or otherwise avoid executing a no-op), or use an accepted, documented MISRA deviation or a compiler-supported "unused" attribute. (If the parameter were volatile or the expression had side effects, the statement would not be dead; that is not the case here.)
